transportAdvice: Cairo has an extensive metro system that connects key areas of the city, though many major tourist sites are not directly on metro lines and may require a taxi or minibus to reach. Taxis are widely available and affordable, but walking long distances is generally impractical due to heavy traffic, heat, and the sprawling nature of the city.

weather.description: Cool and mild winter days with chilly evenings, making it one of the most comfortable months to explore outdoor sites.
Slightly warmer than January with pleasant daytime temperatures and cool nights, still ideal for sightseeing.
Spring begins with warming temperatures, though occasional sandstorms known as khamsin can reduce visibility and bring dusty conditions.
Warm and dry with increasing heat, and the risk of khamsin sandstorms remains; mornings are still pleasant for outdoor activity.
Hot and dry conditions set in, making midday sightseeing uncomfortable; early morning visits to outdoor sites are strongly recommended.
Intense heat with very little relief, even at night; outdoor activities are best limited to early morning or late evening hours.
The hottest month of the year with scorching daytime temperatures; indoor attractions and air-conditioned spaces are essential refuges.
Remains extremely hot and dry with conditions similar to July; hydration and sun protection are critical for any outdoor exploration.
Heat begins to ease slightly toward the end of the month, though conditions are still very warm and dry throughout.
Noticeably more comfortable temperatures return, making this a popular month for tourism with warm days and cooler evenings.
Mild and pleasant weather with comfortable temperatures throughout the day, excellent conditions for visiting monuments and markets.
Cool winter weather returns with crisp evenings; daytime conditions are comfortable for sightseeing and walking around historic areas.
